AudioStoreProxy * mpAudioStoreProxy

Detailed Description

Audio content provider.

The Audio provider contains meta data for all available audio on both internal and external storage devices.

The following example demonstrates how to use this AudioStore class.

 addAudio() {
     // Add an audio
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     AudioStore* audioStore = new AudioStore(*context);
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();

     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_DATA(), filePath);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_TITLE(), audioName);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_DISPLAY_NAME(), audioName);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_MIME_TYPE(), mimeType);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_ARTIST(), artist);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_ALBUM(), album);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_YEAR(), 2010);
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_IS_MUSIC(), true);

     audioStore->add(AudioStore::AUDIO_URI(AudioStore::INTERNAL), *cv);

     delete context;
     delete audioStore;
     delete cv;
 }

 showEditAndDeleteAudio() {
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     AudioStore* audioStore = new AudioStore(*context);
     StringArray selection(3);
     selection.replaceAt(AudioStore::AUDIO_ID(), 0);
     selection.replaceAt(AudioStore::AUDIO_DATA(), 1);
     selection.replaceAt(AudioStore::AUDIO_DISPLAY_NAME(), 2);

     // Show audios
     Cursor* audios = audioStore->getN(
         AudioStore::AUDIO_URI(AudioStore::INTERNAL),
         &selection, NULL, NULL, &AudioStore::AUDIO_ORDER());

     if (audios != NULL && audios->getCount() > 0) {
         audios->moveToFirst();
         do {
             int64_t id = audios->getLong(0);
             String data = audios->getString(1);
             String displayName = audios->getString(2);

             // ...
         } while (audios->moveToNext());
     }
     // Close the cursor
     audios->close();

     // Edit an audio
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();
     cv->addValue(AudioStore::AUDIO_YEAR(), 2011);

     Uri uri1 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(
              AudioStore::AUDIO_URI(AudioStore::INTERNAL), updateId);
     audioStore->set(uri1, *cv, NULL, NULL);

     // Delete an audio
     Uri uri2 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(
              AudioStore::AUDIO_URI(AudioStore::INTERNAL), deleteId);
     audioStore->remove(uri2, NULL, NULL);

     delete context;
     delete audioStore;
     delete cv;
 }

See the sample given above. There are four operations about AudioStore: add, edit, show and remove.

Definition at line 110 of file AudioStore.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::AudioStore::StorageType

Storage Type.

Enumerator:
INTERNAL 

The internal storage.

EXTERNAL 

The primary external storage.

static base::String gaia::content::AudioStore::AUDIO_TRACK ( ) [static]

The track number of this song on the album, if any.

This number encodes both the track number and the disc number. For multi-disc sets, this number will be 1xxx for tracks on the first disc, 2xxx for tracks on the second disc, etc.

Type: INTEGER

static net::Uri gaia::content::AudioStore::getGenreUriForAudioId ( int64_t  audioId,
StorageType  type 
) [static]

Get the content:// style URI for querying the genres of an audio file.

Parameters:
audioIdthe ID of the audio file for which to retrieve the genres.
typeThe type of StorageType.
Returns:
the URI to for querying the genres for the audio file with the given the volume and audioID.
storage::Cursor* gaia::content::AudioStore::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

static base::String gaia::content::AudioStore::keyFor ( const base::String &  name) [static]

Converts a name to a "key" that can be used for grouping, sorting and searching.

The rules that govern this conversion are:

  • remove 'special' characters like ()[]'!?.,
  • remove leading/trailing spaces
  • convert everything to lowercase
  • remove leading "the ", "an " and "a "
  • remove trailing ", the|an|a"
  • remove accents. This step leaves us with CollationKey data, which is not human readable.
Parameters:
nameThe artist or album name to convert.
Returns:
The "key" for the given name.

int32_t gaia::content::AudioStore::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
int32_t gaia::content::AudioStore::set ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const ContentValues &  value,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To update all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
